intro: Malvastrum bryoniifolium, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant is drought-tolerant and has been used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities.
